NATIONAL NEWS






Rethink coal plant, critics urge: Environmentalists take a step toward a legal challenge of Duke Energy's plans



Apr. 24--Five environmental groups have asked state regulators to reconsider a decision allowing Duke Energy to build a coal-fired electric plant west of Charlotte.  The N.C. Utilities Commission in February gave Duke a partial victory in its two-year fight to expand its capacity to generate electricity. Regulators said that Duke could build an 800-megawatt coal plant at the Cliffside site near ...


Apr 24, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



TXU facing power fight



Apr. 25--FPL Energy, the nation's largest producer of wind-generated electricity, has told the Public Utility Commission of Texas that TXU Corp. intentionally flooded West Texas transmission lines with its own higher-cost power to prevent FPL's wind power from reaching customers across the state.  In a letter recently sent to the PUC's director of electric-industry oversight, FPL attorney David ...


Apr 25, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



BSU shows support for wind power: University will buy renewable energy credits from wind farm near Boise to cover cost of power for new dorm



Apr. 24--Boise State University is showing support for renewable energy by purchasing green energy credits from a local wind farm, a small step toward easing the university's dependence on power imported from outside Idaho.  The university is spending $1,500 to buy the renewable energy credits from Lewandowski Farms, which operates three wind turbines off Interstate 84 about 20 miles southeast of ...


Apr 24, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Windmill fight goes on: Bellone sees costs, 'inaccuracies'; Kessel says plan may not be pretty, but grip on fossil fuels must loosen



Apr. 25--A stiff wind kicked up at Gilgo Beach in Babylon yesterday as Town Supervisor Steve Bellone took to a podium planted in the sand to launch an assault on LIPA's proposed windmill project.  Flanked by giant, tipsy photo simulations of the Long Island Power Authority's project and Babylon's own more stark depictions of the 40 turbines, Bellone declared it was time for LIPA to come clean on ...


Apr 25, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



State approves FPL plan for burying power lines, with customers paying the tab



Apr. 25--A proposal approved by state regulators Tuesday will allow local governments and Florida Power & Light Co. to push ahead with plans to bury more overhead power lines, with all ratepayers picking up part of the tab.  The Public Service Commission unanimously approved an FPL proposal under which the utility will pay 25 percent of the cost of burying overhead power lines while communities ...


Apr 25, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



It will cost us all to bury FPL lines



Apr. 25--A proposal approved by state regulators Tuesday will allow local governments and Florida Power & Light Co. to push ahead with plans to bury more overhead power lines, with all ratepayers picking up part of the tab.  The Public Service Commission unanimously approved an FPL proposal under which the utility will pay 25 percent of the cost of burying overhead power lines while communities ...


Apr 25, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Entergy crews to trim around power line



Apr. 25--Entergy Texas customers in Beaumont's West End who are served by a 23-mile long power line that originates in the Amelia substation will see contract crews trimming vegetation away from the line during the next five or six weeks.  The project began earlier this month and will help ensure service continues unimpeded for the estimated 1,200 customers served by that power line.


Apr 25, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Terry pushes hydrogen fuel cell tax credit



Apr. 25--WASHINGTON -- The United States should be moving much faster to reduce its dependence on fossil fuels, and one potential solution may lie in the muggy confines of the Lied Jungle at Omaha's Henry Doorly Zoo.  Hydrogen fuel cell technology provides power and heats water at the jungle, Rep. Lee Terry, R-Neb., said Tuesday at a congressional hearing. Terry is pushing a proposal that would ...


Apr 25, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News





TSX Group Q1 profit up 5% to $36.4M as revenue rises 15% to $101.2M



TORONTO (CP) - TSX Group Inc. (TSX:X) has reported a 15 per cent rise in first-quarter revenue and a five per cent gain in net income as expenses increased 29 per cent. The operator of the Toronto Stock Exchange, the TSX Venture Exchange and the Natural Gas Exchange said Wednesday it earned $36.4 million or 53 cents per share in the January-March period on revenue of $101.2 million.


Apr 25, 2007 Canadian Business Magazine



Cardin, Mikulski propose bill to shift LNG siting power to states



Local and state governments would get full veto power over proposed liquefied natural gas import terminals under legislation Maryland Democrats Benjamin Cardin and Barbara Mikulski recently introduced in the US Senate. The bill, S. 1174, would gut a part of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 that solidified the US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's final permit authority over LNG projects.


Apr 24, 2007 Platts



Promenade wind turbines installed



It is hoped Blackpool's windy coast will boost energy levelsTwo wind turbines are arriving on Blackpool's promenade on Tuesday to help power the resort's famous illuminations. They will sit on the front, close to the Sandcastle Water Park, and will be joined by a third in May. Although the turbines cost 147,000, councillors hope they will cut 13,250 off the town's annual energy bill.


Apr 24, 2007 BBC



Pennsylvania Utility Commission Approves Macquarie Acquisition of Duquesne Light Holdings



- 1:08 p.m. PITTSBURGH (AP) - The Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission Tuesday approved the purchase of Duquesne Light Holdings Inc., the parent company of electric utility Duquesne Light, by a group of private equity firms for $1.59 billion, Duquesne said. Macquarie Infrastructure Partners, a unit of the Macquarie Group, an Australian financial company, is leading the buyout.

Report: China Will Pass U.S. As Polluter



Report Says China to Pass U.S. As Top Greenhouse Gas Emitter This Year The Associated Press SHANGHAI, China - China will pass the United States as the world's biggest source of greenhouse gasses this year, an official with the International Energy Agency was quoted as saying. China had been forecast to surpass the U.S. in 2010, but its sizzling economic growth has pushed the date forward, the ...

The Market for Distributed & Cogeneration Power Electronics is Expected to be Worth $7.6 Billion in 2011

Distributed & Cogeneration (DCG) is gaining momentum and becoming an attractive energy option for the new millennium. Demand for power reliability combined with increasing power ...

Enel Is Interested in Acquiring Russian Power Generators, Brentan Says



Italy's Enel Interested in Russia Power Generators OGK-4, OGK-5 By Yuriy Humber and Nina de Roy April 24 (Bloomberg) -- Enel SpA, Italy's largest utility, said it will examine Russian generators OAO OGK-4 and OAO OGK-5 as potential acquisitions a month after losing out in an auction for Siberian electricity producer OAO OGK-3. ''Russia is one market that is fundamental to us based on its size and ...


Apr 24, 2007 Bloomberg



China's sun king offers energy alternatives



SHANGHAI, China - Physicist Shi Zhengrong spent the 1990s in an Australian lab studying solar power, a field he picked by chance. He expected to devote his life to science.  Still, Shi saw signs of a blossoming industry as Germany, Japan and other countries invested in cleaner power. Excited by a trip home that showed him China's rapid development, he startled friends by abruptly moving his wife ...

Companies invest billions in PNG gas industry



The Papua New Guinea gas industry has found a new player willing to invest $7 billion into commercialising the country's natural gas reserves. Liquid Niugini Gas Limited, a partnership between three international companies, submitted the multi-billion dollar proposal to the Government. PNG Prime Minister Sir Michael Somare described the project as an important step in the country's bid to become ...

U.S. Criticizes Iran-European Gas Deal



Irritated by the prospect of a huge European gas development deal with Iran, the Bush administration said Monday it will argue that such transactions undercut international bargaining power over Irans nuclear program. Also Monday, the State Department said it has again asked Iran for information about a missing former FBI agent. The United States says it has no information to substantiate reports ...
